results.title: Gopal's golden pendant: India
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Looks at a family in Jaipur, India, whose members are master craftsmen in the art of enamelling gold and silver. In particular, the film focuses on a ten-year-old boy who has been learning the craft since he was six. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Goori goori dreaming (A)
results.brief_description: Goori Goori Dreaming is a glimpse into the culture, traditions and spirit of Australia. Woven through the film are the contemporary paintings of Gunaminy Vanessa Fisher, as she teaches her family about the earth and their heritage.

results.title: Google HD Cardboard 2.0
results.brief_description:
Viewer made from cardboard and plastic folded to form a VR viewing device..
Google, USA, 2014
results.description: It doesn’t take a rocket scientist to use VR. At least, not anymore. While DIY VR devices like Google Cardboard are now common, there was once a time when we needed to visit NASA to experience virtual reality. That time was 1985, when the space agency used VR to train pilots and astronauts. Their prototype used sensors to track the user’s movements so that the artificial reality they saw appeared and responded like real life. Google Cardboard looks less impressive, but its low cost and its ability to work with any smartphone make it possible for even non-astronauts to explore virtual worlds.
description_for_label: It doesn’t take a rocket scientist to use VR. At least, not anymore. While DIY VR devices like Google Cardboard are now common, there was once a time when we needed to visit NASA to experience virtual reality. That time was 1985, when the space agency used VR to train pilots and astronauts. Their prototype used sensors to track the user’s movements so that the artificial reality they saw appeared and responded like real life. Google Cardboard looks less impressive, but its low cost and its ability to work with any smartphone make it possible for even non-astronauts to explore virtual worlds.

results.title: Goofy's freeway troubles (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ken Peterson and Les Clark
results.brief_description: In this amusing driver education animation, Goofy demonstrates some common freeway problems that can be avoided by following a simple checklist which includes the car, the driver, the freeway and basic common sense.

results.title: Goods traffic for Europe
results.brief_description: Every day some 15,000 goods trains transport their freights to and from the national and international markets contributing to the supply of thousands of European towns. In addition 14,000 passenger trains travel 600,000 miles daily carrying approximately 44 million people.
